root.para: Although the auditor may decide that the most efficient and effective strategy is to undertake most of the audit procedures in relation to valuation and presentation close to period-end, audit procedures in relation to other assertions, such as completeness and existence, may be tested at an interim period. For example, tests of controls may be performed at an interim period for more routine controls, such as IT controls and authorizations for new products. Also, it may be effective to test the operating effectiveness of controls over new product approval by gathering evidence at an interim period of the appropriate level of management sign-off on a new financial instrument.
